oftamologia-intro-para: It is a project that aims to guarantee visual health and provide glasses to people with a precarious economic situation. It began in July 2015 and is a collaborative project between the Ramon Martí Bonet Foundation of the Catalan Retina Institute and the Santa Clara Convent Foundation.
oftamologia-card1-para: Throughout the year, professionals and volunteers from the Santa Clara Convent Foundation, with the support of a van provided by the Joviat School, accompany individuals in need of a visual check-up. These individuals have previously been assessed at the Ramon Martí Bonet Foundation, located on Pau Alcover Street in Barcelona.
oftamologia-card2-para: Beneficiaries are provided with visits to the ophthalmologist, including comprehensive check-ups. If necessary, they may also receive glasses and additional tests such as campimetry, tonometry, and OCT.
oftamologia-card3-para: The average number of users served in recent years is 88 people. 15% of the beneficiaries are minors and 85% are adults. 44% of users are men and 56% women.

news.title: Mass at the Sagrada Familia
news.subtitle: A Historic Concert for Peace: Music as a Bridge of Solidarity towards Ukraine
news.body:
On December 12, 2023, the iconic Sagrada Familia in Barcelona became a symbol of solidarity and hope. The 'Mass at the Sagrada Familia', an event organized by Sister Lucía Caram along with the Fundació del Convent de Santa Clara and businessman Enrique Tomás, featured performances by Pasión Vega, David Bisbal, and an esteemed choir and orchestra. The event brought together not only the local community but also generous souls from around the world in a historic charity concert for peace. The goal was to raise vital funds for the construction of a field hospital and to send humanitarian aid to Ukraine, a country ravaged by war.

The event was blessed with the presence of Ukrainian doctors and soldiers, who, along with government officials and a multitude of faithful, gathered under the vaults of Gaudí's masterpiece. The support of Pope Francis was felt not only in words but also in the spirit that permeated the place. It was a night when music became a vehicle of unity, and Ariel Ramírez's 'Misa Criolla' resonated in the hearts of those present. This work, which transcends language and cultural barriers with its fusion of folk rhythms and liturgical texts, elevated the ceremony to a plane of moving spirituality.

The choice of 'Misa Criolla' for this occasion was no accident; Ramírez's work, with its deep roots in South American folklore and its universal message of peace and brotherhood, was the perfect complement for a night dedicated to solidarity with Ukraine. The fervent and passionate performance of the mass became a symbol of the resilience and hope of a people striving to build peace amid conflict.

As music filled every corner of the temple, donations flowed generously. The night's success was remarkable: significant funds were raised for the cause. This act of collective generosity demonstrated that the global community can unite and act as one to alleviate the suffering of those in greatest need. With the 'Mass at the Sagrada Familia', Barcelona became a beacon of hope, projecting a message of solidarity that will undoubtedly transcend time and continue to inspire acts of compassion and mutual support.

news.title: Book Launch 'Invited to Rebuild': A Call to Solidarity with Ukraine
news.subtitle: A work that delves into the war in Ukraine and the importance of compassion in times of conflict
news.body:
The recent launch of the book 'Invited to Rebuild: Ukraine, War, and Compassion', written by Sister Lucía Caram, brought together several influential personalities to discuss the situation in Ukraine. Defense Minister Margarita Robles highlighted during the event the justice of the Ukrainian cause and the need to confront authoritarian regimes like Putin's in Russia.

Additionally, figures such as Juan Carlos Cruz, Henry Kwofie, and Masala contributed their unique perspectives on the war, emphasizing the importance of supporting peace efforts and humanitarian aid. Each of them, from their experience and vision, reinforced the central message of the book: the urgency of showing solidarity with Ukraine and the importance of compassion in times of conflict.

Sister Lucía Caram's work not only narrates the events of the Ukrainian conflict but also offers a deep reflection on the international response to the war. It calls for action, emphasizing the importance of humanitarian aid and the need for a peaceful solution. Through its pages, 'Invited to Rebuild' becomes a platform to better understand the crisis in Ukraine and to mobilize society in support of efforts to restore peace and provide relief to the victims of the conflict.
